thread.title: Lincoln-Way East football keeps streak alive with win over Lockport
thread.title_full: Lincoln-Way East football keeps streak alive with win over Lockport

title: Lincoln-Way East football keeps streak alive with win over Lockport
text:
Lincoln-Way East football keeps streak alive with win over Lockport Published: Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 11:04 p.m. CDT By JEFF DeGRAW - Shaw Media Correspondent 
FRANKFORT â€“ The last time Lockport defeated Lincoln-Way East in football was during the 2004 regular season. Related Links Wilmington football barely streaks past Herscher for I-8 Small title 
On Friday night, the Griffins' streak continued with a 48-6 SouthWest Suburban Blue victory. 
East (5-1, 4-0) jumped out to a 28-6 first-half lead on the legs and arm of quarterback Brandon Bauer. 
Bauer had 18 carries for 115 yards and was 6 of 9 passing for another 90 yards in the first half. He ended the game with 27 carries for 176 yards and was 13 of 22 passing for 164 yards. He added two rushing touchdowns and two through the air. 
After East started the game with a three-and-out, Lockport (1-5, 1-3) drove to the East 6-yard line, but two penalties and an incomplete pass forced the Porters to go for it on fourth down. A fumble on the fake field goal gave East the ball. 
Bauer then ran the ball on four consecutive plays and gained 31 yards. After a 6-yard sack, Nigel Muhammad ran 53 yards for the first East touchdown with 5:24 in the opening quarter. 
Lockport scored on the next possession as Ben Davis hit Deiondre Taylor with a 60-yard pass. The missed extra point made it 7-6. 
Bauer and the Griffins took control the rest of the game.
